text: Green Goddess dip is one of my absolute
favorites when I'm entertaining but so
often it's just full of mayonnaise and
sour cream this is a really refreshing
update on the classic and we're going to
use avocado and buttermilk so start by
having and pitting one ripe avocado
ripeness is a key here peel the avocado
this way you get as much of this dark
green layer of the avocado as possible
and that's where a lot of the nutrients
are once your avocados are peeled simply
add them to food processor if you have
really nice ripe avocados you don't even
need a shop them to this I'm going to
add two anchovies now this is what I
think really gives Green Goddess dip its
characteristic brine enos to this I'm
going to add one and a half cups of
low-fat buttermilk this is going to add
a really nice rich tininess and the
creaminess now this is what I think
makes Green Goddess Green Goddess
wonderful fresh herbs so I'm using one
cup of fresh herbs minced chives you can
use a combination of any of these I
think they're all terrific some fresh
tarragon I think this is pretty much
essential you got to have tarragon and
Green Goddess some fresh basil adds a
really nice sweetness and some parsley
now for a little bit more acidic kick
I'm going to add one tablespoon and a t
of white wine vinegar let's process this
so it's absolutely wonderful let's say
I'm just going to scrape down the sides
season it with salt now remember you've
got two anchovies in there which are

just a little bit more and some pepper
black pepper it's so nice in this and
continue processing okay oh this is such

you happen to have in the fridge the
